values:
This dog at work keeps eating poop, to the point of illness.  Like, he will eat a bunch of shit and then later he will barf up a turd.  Sometimes whole.  It is, get this, grosser than you're imagining right now.  Now imagine what his shits look like!
My coworkers are being super passive right now, too, so I'm doing the brunt of the dirty work.  Like one just surfs the internet all day, and my boss keeps building shit out of PVC pipe or covering things in vinyl.  Meanwhile all the dogs are shitting and pissing everywhere, and I'm standing knee deep holding a soggy mop and going "yipes!"
no fairs.

OK, this is going to make Kevin crazy, but I kind of want another dog. Last night I had a dream where I had some kind of brown spotted terrier and I named it Dougal ("Doogie") and it was super cute. I think it was supposed to be a Jack Russell. Anyway now the seed has been planted AND I already have a name picked out AND I went to the Santa Cruz SPCA website (the place we got Beezy) and look at the cute dog they have! Tell me he wouldn't make a cute Dougal: I want it! I know its not allowed and irresponsible and dumb and I should be happy with the dog I have (I am!) but I want it! + = <3! I also want to quit my job, because now that I have my own dog it kind of sucks to deal with other people's dogs all day, in the same way that nobody likes other people's kids. The reason I started working at daycares is that I needed my doggie "fix", but having one dog - and certainly TWO - kind of solves that problem. Now I'm just a poop-scooping vomit-cleaning floor-mopping burnout :(

The other day I was eating an onion (cooked), and I remembered the lamb kebabs I always got in Taco Turco II in Alicante.  I was immediately tempted to spend the thousand bucks to fly back to shitty old Alicante just for one precious precious kebab.  Now I can't get it out of my head.  They also had the best wine I have ever had, at 8 euros a bottle.

Oh, god, please gimme.

OMG trouble at the office today.



A dog lost an eye.


LOST AN EYEEE!

First off, remember my last post?  The one about all the dogsitting?  Jilly's mom totally stiffed me!  She told Melissa she had a credit card on file (she doesn't) and the phone number is bad.  Gimme my $140, bitch!

Secondly, I just googled "Marley & Me animal rights".
What.  The fuck.  Nearly all the reviews are like "omg the movie is so great it is a delight to dog lovers everywhere!"  Even crazy old PETA supports the movie, having convinced the movie people to change the script (Marley is adopted instead of bought from a puppy mill).  Still, there are so many things wrong with this movie, and from what I hear the book is way worse.  
Positive reinforcement is still pretty unfamiliar to a lot of dog owners, and it would have been so easy to use the movie as a way to teach dog-friendly training.  Instead they chose to glamorize choke chain strangulation.  There is nothing cute or funny about the way this dog's behavioral issues are dealt with.
Every time a movie like this comes out, dogs are adopted on impulse and abandoned.  After 101 dalmations came out, shelters saw a huge increase in dalmations, which are especially susceptible to defects from poor breeding practices.  Beverly Hills Chihuahua: more chihuahuas in shelters.  You can bet the puppy mills were working hard to crank out enough lab puppies in time for Christmas.

P.S. Try googling "puppies for sale" sometime.  A lot of commercial breeders use the internet to sell puppies, copying text and pictures from legitimate, responsible breeders to make their operation seem reputable.  This is especially unfortunate as so many people are complete fucking idiots who don't know any better.
</rant>

So right now there are 4 dogs in my tiny studio. I am also feeding Heather's 2 cats at her place. It's a pretty wacky holiday season! Mocha has diarrhea and unbelievably stinky farts. Socrates barks at everything. Mocha bolted out the door and into the tranny neighbor's apartment while Beezy barked at him/her. Beezy stole Scooter's prozac out of his mouth, threw up a huge pile of partially-digested kibble 10 minutes later. Everyone is chasing everyone. But right now they are all settled down for a long winter's nap. Me-e-e-e-e-rry Christmas!

Exciting new discovery! I can do whatever I want when my puppy's asleep. Case in point: unicorn costume
first I scotch taped the horn on then the mane and tail then she woke up and would no longer cooperate :(

I GOT A PUPPY! GUYS, SERIOUSLY, I GOT A PUPPY! We got Beezy (shelter name Kate) today, and she is so much cuter than the pictures I had seen. She's small - around 11 pounds, 5 months old, and in all honesty probably the cutest puppy I've ever seen. She was put in a drop-box (what is she, a library book?) with her litter at a tiny 8 weeks and has lived in the shelter this whole time. She's super super hyperactive, like A.D.D. even for a puppy, but she's also really well behaved. She's crate trained, a little bit potty-trained, and has only played with approved toys - no chewing of electrical cords, cell phones, or shoes so far. Bragging about my kid: I gave her dinner tonight one piece at a time, and each piece she either did Sit, Stand, or Down for me. Did I mention she's only 5 months old and never had any training? So basically I can't stop smiling and I love her and Kevin loves her and she is going to have a blast playing with all the daycare dogs! She gets really sleepy in the middle of playing Zoolander pose. BEEEEEEEEZZZYYYYYY!

Nooooooo!  I was going to go get Gypsy tomorrow!  I was puppyproofing the house while I was on hold with the shelter!  I was going to make my landlord sign the papers before work this morning!  Most importantly, I got Kevin to go along with it!
Wah!


I'll miss you, Gypsy, I'm sorry you had to get stolen by people who are probably stupid about dogs.  They'll never be able to socialize you like I could.  :(


Basenji puppy pls.

I really hope that for the VP debate they refrain from giving Palin a microphone.

Obviously because she's an idiot, but more importantly:

YOU DON'T HAVE TO SHOUT, WHINY, WE CAN HEAR YOU FINE!

I forgot to tell you guys something Today I met the most. ridiculous. dog. ever. I don't know if you can tell from the picture, but he has this wicked underbite with vampire fangs, and somehow the tongue sticks out at the same time. Need I point out that the nose is placed directly between the eyeballs? (He's a Brussels Griffon, in case you were going to run out and buy one.)

Sometimes it's easier to just do the damn dishes instead of complaining about it and letting them pile up.






Other times, though, it's more cathartic to point out that the mister made a deal to do the dishes but then went away on business without doing them, and that it happened right after the one who got left behind sliced  through one of their dishwashing gloves so things get all pruney after washing a million trillion billion dishes.

WTF is up with the laundry room here.  The floor is covered in water, 3 of 5 washers don't work, the one of two that works the best is being heavily bogarted.  My $6 left one load sitting in a pool of dirty water, another one with the classic cartoon "soap situation".  I'm soaking wet and only half of my shit made it to the dryer.







By god I may just have to WRITE A LETTER!
(You know, that thing uptight white people do when they receive sub-par service)

the ZenGria ("kind of like an asian sangria"):

White zin, heated in a pot so you can steep
2 green tea bags. Add
A bag of frozen cherries
A can of lychees, plus 1/4 cup of their corn syrup "juice"
A can of mandarin oranges, undrained.
Add a dash of plum wine and pour over ice cubes.

Ugh.

About three seconds later she suggested buying a "candle-abra" for your outdoor picnic.

How come some boys are cool, like normal human beings or whatever, and other boys are all "Dude, frat parties!  Dude, chicks at the gym in tank tops!  Everyone but me is a fag!  Dude, beer and UFC!"???

Also how come when both kinds get together the normal boys act like the bro-kind and not the other way around?

Did you know it it hard to photograph fish with a mid-level digital camera? It is. This is all they have been doing so far. Boring! Stop schooling already! And those are your reflections. Of yourselves. Water ballet Siamese twin fish! Augh!!! Rrrrodolfo. The other 2. Speeding violation.

Um, I got new fish. 4 of them. To replace the one that died. Because I am an irresponsible fish-owner. Here's three of them in their bag, acclimating. See, basically I know what I'm doing, I am just not going to change their water, ever. EDIT: That castle and the fake brick wall cost me $0.22, on account of I am such a baller. A ballah. Yeah... I smashed the castle on the floor until it broke up enough to fit in my stupid small tank. On account of I am such a balllllaahhh... Did you know that I could be making 30G's per year doing stained glass part time?!? At least, I think I could. If I could sell everything I made. That's me making the same money as like teachers or whatever (ca-ching!) doing something I actually LIKE doing. From home! Remember the time I bought that awesome cookware? Remember the time I used it to make meatball soup? Ok, how about the time I made valentime's candy at work?

Oh, man, I have not written in such a long time.  Back then I was still making sock monkeys, going on grotesque candy-binges with Erin and working on my senior project and stuff.  Now I am pretty much making various soups, throwing my precious soul down the gaping maw of the Retail Industry, trying to find pants that fit me, working on my senior project, and acting like a four-year-old (not all of these things are negative). 
Yeah, that is pretty much what is going on with me.
Oh, and I also had a hilarious misadventure with eyelash curlers, increased the quantity of kitchen gear by about 3000%, grossly overtipped a pizza delivery girl, and probably had other misadventures - hilarious and otherwise.
Um, it just occurred to me that I also lived in Spain for 6 months, but, whatever.  Not important.
Also my shitty off-brand mp3 player combusted or something.
Finally, I am not really friends any more with 85% of my LJ friends, so nobody even reads this, but whatever.  not important.
All caught up.

I am so tired of fanatics.

Last weekend Lisa and Ernie and I went to eat at Dick's Last Resort in Old Town.  There was a big group of people there being pretty rowdy, considering they were in the 40 year range.  I'd say the majority were smoking, which is gross.  There was a lady wearing an entire flag outfit including the sequined hat, which was grosser.  There was some slutty old bitch wearing pants that were a combination of jeans and sweatpants, which was grossest of all.  So all in all they were pretty rednecky - can you guess yet who they were?  I didn't put it together, and then I noticed they were putting these stickers all over that said SDMM.  Now did you guess?  It took me a few more minutes to get it:
They were minute men.
For insight into why I immediately hated them, rewind to a few weeks earlier.  I was on the train and there was a magazine on the seat next to me.  I flipped through it and found this article spotlighting an illegal immigrant.  It was basically the same story you've heard a hundred times about the hardworking dude who went to great lengths to come work in the US.  Call me a tree hugging, head-in-the-clouds liberal, but that's quite an effort.  What the fuck have I done to be here?  I just am.  I sure as hell didn't walk through a desert for 3 days without water, or even ride a bus for several days.  And let's face it, I bring nothing to the table.  Like many of us, I slack off at work (if I deign to even get a job) and then bitch about not getting a raise.  I'm fairly sure the same thing goes for the fucking minute men.  Why do they have any more right to be here than someone whose great great grandparents didn't immigrate before some arbitrary cut-off point?  
Oh, and I don't believe that "supporting our troops" is a good enough excuse.  That does not make you a capital-A (cue music) American.  If you haven't really truly paid the price, get out.  If this is such a great country, you should have to earn the right to be here.  And if that were to happen, I wonder who would come out ahead; Sally Mae Flaghat, or the guy who runs the taco shop?

OK If a dozen or so fairly complicated factors play out as I want them to, and 3 specific planets align... then I might be able to finish this academic year, study abroad in Spain fall semester, and then graduate from Poly, no additional quarters needed.

Why do girls have to be such fucking bitches?  Honestly, what posesses someone to intentionally hurt a total stranger?  (it's a rhetorical question, the answer is jealousy)  

Fucking bitches need to stay in the kitchen, since they obviously fuck everything up otherwise.

underrated good treat: bread and butter. have some. maybe put just a little honey on top of the butter. i'm restless. i want to see kevin, but he's not fit to drive right now. i need a motorcycle. i want to go to frog and peach again and have a practice/training beer (cider). i need money. i want to thoroughly ruin myself by using food for comfort/to combat boredom. i need food and/or self control. there was nature show on our channel today for some reason. there was an african armadillo of some kind, but it didn't look like a "regular" armadillo like you would find in texas. it was cool though. its scales are razor sharp; i didn't know that. armadillo balling up: Ah, here we go. it is called a pangolin. they are related to the armadillo, but maybe not quite the same? this one has a baby, which is cute. curled up

ok, here is my scheme: i am going to see if the owner guy down at Traditional Tattoo will do my (family members: do not read this!) skull tattoo in exchange for this: it is my design idea for a stained glass panel. just you wait, man, the 2-dimensionality makes it ideal for glass. it will rock. the background is going to be open (no glass) and it will have a border around the whole thing. depending on who cooperates, i will either etch -"TRADITIONAL TATTOO", "TIGER ROSE TATTOO" (shop in pismo), or nothing- into the border. SWEET.

ok, FUCK. OPRAH.  seriously.  she is a horrible woman and i hate her and all that she stands for.  
today she brought in 3 sons who had turned their father in for armed robbery.  i guess the dad used to be an upstanding citizen, but then he had an affair and robbed like 5 banks with an unloaded gun.  so these 3 grown men made a decision that affected their father, a grown man.  i don't have a problem with that.  what i do have a problem with is that oprah has spent 2 days making everyone in the nation wallow in the supposed misery the father has put his sons through.  they are whining and bitching about how they are sad and confused and don't understand how their father could have done such a thing and lied to them and boo hoo hoo.  the father has apologized a lot and is willing to pay for his actions, but according to oprah AND the guest psychologist she flew in to help her deride him, his apology was "empty", and he "just doesn't get it".  they want the sons to really think about their feelings and how their fathers actions made them feel and what this means to them... bullshit like that.  
if you are a grownup you make decisions and you stand by them.  that's what this father did.  he robbed banks, and he pled guilty and went to jail.  the sons did too.  they turned their dad in to the police.  and they need to move on.  what possible use would it be to get all huffy and offended like the dad took a gun into their own personal houses and said "hand over your wife and kids"?  if anything, they should feel guilty for sending their dad to jail.  but somehow HE put THEM in this horrible position where they had to make this monumental decision and gol-ding-it he is just scewing up their perfect lives!  what possible good does it do to have oprah's pet psychologist not only validate them in this, but actually suggest that the 3 sons get together and have a good cry?  She literally told them that a good solution would be to cry together.  am i just too masculine for my own good?  is it that crazy for me to be thinking "so what"?
at one point the dad was saying that yes, he would turn his father in if his father were a pedophile, murderer, rapist... at which point oprah interrupts with "or bank robber?".  that is exactly oprah's problem (one of them?).  she lumps 60 year old men who rob banks with unloaded guns because they were too old to get a job with murderers and pedophiles.  i mean, killing children, taking money - it's practically the same thing!  to her there is no possible way for a person to make some really bad choices and yet NOT be an evil person.  bank robber = bad guy.  it is absolute.  and her fucking brainwashed audience applauds in absolute agreement.  oprah could -and probably would- say something like "your husband sneezed too loudly, so you erupted in a fit of sobbing and forced him out of the house with a kitchen knife... you go girl!" and the audience would cheer.  not a single person would say "hey... isn't that a tad harsh?  she sounds a little moody to me."  cause fuck, man, it's OPRAH!  
the glaring contradiction, of course, is that i should have turned off the tv instead of watching it all and then writing up a blog bitching about how oprah offends me.  but i like the background noise when i'm working.



ps i think i need one of those sun lamps that S.A.D. people get.  cause i think i'm one of them.  it is all  shitty out and i just been cranky all day.  except when it was sunny and i was walking to school.  right now it is the kind of weather for listening to mean rap about cutting up my bitches and also for snacking.

pps speaking of rap, eminem got back together with kim?  man, i bet he is embarassed about that!

right now: eating 1.5 servings minute rice [i didnt have enough for 2 (sad face)] with leftover mc'donalds sweet 'n' sour dipping sauce (repeat sad face) also kool-aid (pleased-looking face). cause i'm one classy bitch. this afternoon/evening: started a new stained glass project; birds of paradise semicircle. my desire to make an ornate stained glass turd remains unwavered. any takers? erin stopped by and i gave her a crash course on glass cutting. i have inspired her and we are going to go buy glass one of these days. last night: choked kevin to the point of unconsciousness. laughed, then later felt bad about it. yesterday: went with geny to get her tattoo. it looks cool, but it is not quite what she wanted. i am not sure how a lily "not filled in all the way with maybe yellow or white highlights" turns into a completely filled in orange tiger lily... unless the tattoo artist silently decides it would just look better that way. but again, it looks cool, and geny thinks it looks cool, but most of me is still going "yeah but what the FUCK!?!" i showed the guy my skull design: and he said it was "awesome". i would be pissed though if i went in to have that done and the guy was all "hummm... i think i'll make it purple without saying anything to inform the tattooee of my decision" let's see... i've told you what i ate, said stuff about people you don't know, and been slightly sarcastic. is that bloggy enough for you?

where is my camera?  i am not going to finish that roll of film this way, i can tell you that.  somewhere i have a camera, and it has pictures of my window i made - before it was broken.  and i wanna see how they turned out/add them to my "portfolio".  but where is that camera?  if your name is kevin, please take a moment to consider if it might be at your house.  if your name is something else, please take a moment to pity me.  i'm gonna go look for it some more.


helpful hint: if you are doing a good job of pitying me, i could also use some quarters.

ok let's see... i made friends with a cute girl in my italian class.  well... myspace friends... but soon... soon she will be my friend.  and by soon i mean class tomorrow.  i will tell her my best jokes, or better yet, not tell her any jokes. i got "friend requested", so i was checking out her profile, studying up on useful data for when i woo her tomorrow, and i saw that she likes the color orange.  
which reminded me: remember punky brewster?  i only remember 3 of the episodes, the first that came to mind being the one where punky falls hard for this hunky older boy - i remember him being indeed very hunky - and learns that his favorite color is orange.  she immediately begins dressing herself entirely in exclusively orange clothing.  This is essentially what i was thinking of doing.  i am not well.  eventually punky comes to terms with the fact that the hunky boy is too old for her, it would never work.  i can only conjecture as to whether or not this will apply in my situation, as this girl is just a tad younger than me, but also has a boyfriend.  
the second episode of punky brewster that i thought of is actually the first one, cause i thought of it months ago.  it is the one where punky and friends are playing hide and go seek.  one kid, i think it was the little black girl, becomes trapped in an attempt to hide in an old fridge.  she almost dies somehow (runs out of air, probably), but is fortunately rescued by punky's adoptive father.  a couple of months ago i was walking down n. chorro and i happened upon an old fridge, door wide open.  "hey, i should get in there" i thought.  and then i thought of punky.  i kept walking, had i not... who knows...  to this day i wonder what horrible fate might have befallen me.
i actually had a little help from geny bringing this last one to mind.  but it all came rushing back.  remember the one where punky's illiterate friend is babysitting her (punky's?) little brother?  the brother drinks liquid bleach or drano or something, and gets all poisoned and sick.  the friend calls poison control, but as she is illiterate she is unable to read the offending bottle (induce vomiting, etc).  i remember that episode being pretty darn intense.  i was so angry with that girl for not being able to read.  it is not her fault i guess.  we should blame the school systems perhaps?  i am not sure about the moral of that one.  
so, if you remember any more punky brewster episodes, tell me about them and we can be all "oh MAN!  i remember that one!  that was awesome!  and punky's dog did that one thing... oh MAN!"
also, if you went around with a bandana on your leg like punky, i want to know about that, too.  i thought that was the coolest thing ever.  punky was a fucking fashionable little girl.
ps we can also talk about saved by the bell.  i'm flexible.

i got mail today! i hardly ever get mail (insert something about the old 'no news is good news' cliche), but today i got 2 pieces! the first one was tax info. i had forgotten that the gov stole my money for taxes but will have to give it back. so i will be getting money, which is good. but i will have to be all responsible about w-40's and pen-15's and filing shit, which is less than desireable. anyways, the second piece of mail was a big manila envelope from cal poly. "great," i thought. "it's some kind of court summons or notice of dismissal." so i opened it up, and it was this:
i lol'ed. i think i am going to try to find my notice of academic probation and display the 2 together. in some rich mahogany frames.

so, i have been in a real good mood, not sure why, but not complaining.  
(please note that it is "chipper".  i'm chipper!)
i tickled kevin, but in a good way, so as not to get yelled at and then we wrassled and i won and he was like "ow that is my arm, get off me you crazy terrorizing she-beast!  i can't believe you are so powerful!  and wise, also wise!"  ok maybe not all of that happened.  he wouldn't dare call me a she-beast.
there was this headline-y blurb on msn when i was checking my hotmail.  you know how they have the "msn today" bullshit with like "10 ways to better eating habits"?  the headline was something like "1 in 6 teenagers are bipolar" and the article was saying that clearly all young people are either bipolar or have a.d.d., citing "mood swings" as evidence.  hey msn team, ever hear of hormones?  people have them, they are pretty rampant in adolescents.  there is, like, estrogen and testosterone battling for supremacy and all that stuff.  it's not uncommon.  i remember getting all pissed off at my mom for asking me how my day was, and you know what?  i settled down and grew out of it.  and sometimes, i don't feel like studying.  sometimes i would rather run around outside, and that makes it hard to focus.  but not every hyper kid has a disorder.  maybe, just maybe, it is not necessary for the entire population to be on drugs.  (ps i know that bi-bolarity or bi-polarism or whatever is due to hormone imbalances and shit.  just saying that maybe hormones don't have a "normal" balance 100% of the time.)
i promise i am still in a good mood.  i just wanted to rant, happily, about retarded drug-pushing grownups.

it's probably not on your calendars, but did you know that yesterday was jackie-is-a-narcissist day?  I bought myself flowers, and i made myself chocolate covered strawberries, and saw a movie (HEADS GOT RIPPED OFF!).  cause i'm in love with myself. (cue lame segue) speaking of love, you know what else?  i like kevin. a lot.  i know people do not really like to read that sort of thing, they roll their eyes and all that, but you know what, people?  i hate you.
(cue awesome segue)
people i don't hate: where the heck is my hottie of a roommate?  erin, where are you?  i think ralph is out of town this weekend, so what the eff, man!?!
(no segue whatsoever)
i am sitting here all night, in a non-loser sort of way, so there's a good chance i might think of more stuff to write. regardless, i am gonna go draw - something i haven't done in too long.  i don't know why doodling stick figures requires such a high level of focus, but i can't do it when i am a) distracted by boys, or b)at my parents' house.  being at home seriously saps my creativity.  i cant paint or anything.  coming up with a design for my window took about a week of mental agony.   (i sound like some sort of hard-core artist... lame)

i just remembered i fixed my scanner. i can scan things: i am kind of going through a kitten phase right now. i saw some aesthetically perfect kitten on a commercial and now i want one. problem is, kittens turn out to be cats, which is gay. i feel that the artwork shown above not only illustrates my sentiments on the matter, but also proposes a solution. if only all art were so accomodating. except, have you heard of bengal cats? they are the prettiest cats in the world and they are friendly too, from what i can tell (hint: most common housecats are not). anyways, this was not supposed to be an entry about cats. it was supposed to be about my scanner. hurray, scanner!
i just got back from a hot date.  it was hot.

news flash: i am socially awkward.  i have been noticing more and more that i do weird things in class to try to win friends (and influence people).  since the quarter started i think i have alienated and/or induced pity from more people than you think.  I have:
shouted enthusiastically at a girl about plywood and concrete (she started it!)
told jokes about mozart
performed my version of stand up comedy ("and what's the deal with lampshades?!?")
followed a girl, repeatedly interrupting her conversations to inform her we have 2 classes together
made mating calls
thrown newspapers
laughed obnoxiously
and much, much more.

i am also becoming a huge linguistics nerd.  i am thinking about doing my senior project on pronouns.  i followed a guy today who talking in spanish on his cell phone.  i analyzed communicative strategies.  
this is getting way too confessional.  i should clarify that i wasn't chasing him through stairwells or anything, i swear.  i was just walking real real close. 

also i am being taken out to a fancy dinner tomorrow - yay!

just wanted to let you all know...
i'm stupid

so, i am not exactly grabbing life by the balls right now. or even by the horns as Dodge would have me do. pretty much i am waiting for it to be not 8 o'clock so i can go to bed. (wheeee!) 8 o clock is too early for me. i'm tired though and my head has been killing me most of the day. have you ever wondered how hard it would be to find $100+ worth of sequined lingerie? (that is to say, lingerie that is encrusted with sequins in stereotypical Vegas-showgirl fashion) the answer is NOT AS HARD AS YOU THINK sometimes i marvel at the feats i manage. speaking of which, i only attend classes 2 days per week. i'm pretty much rad. but i still contend that i am earning my education, because all of my classes are filled with retarded weinerly children and smarmy know-it-all globetrotters. hey, it's a lot to put up with! i mean it, you know those people that are always like going on religious missions to 3rd world countries, all befriending indigenous peoples so they can eventually gain their trust and BAM! CONVERTED TO THE GOSPEL! yeah, those people. wouldn't it suck to hang out with those people? now imagine that there are several concentrated in one area, say, a classroom, for 2 hours at a time several times a week. in the spirit of education, they tend to feel a need to share their wealth of wisdom with everybody... BARF! now imagine that they are doing it in broken spanish with an extremely forced-sounding accent. oh, and the weinerly children are mostly in my italian class. i think it is mostly freshmen. god, some of those kids are such weiners!

so, i have decided that this saturday, for one day, i shall experiment with being a "people person".  i am going to, just for a change of pace, split some infinitives.  i mean... try to be actively nice to people.  i am going to go to a party and talk to girls without getting pissed off, not sit in the corner, and just generally make nice.  amazing, i know.  
i'll do it, but that doesn't mean i understand it.  what is up with people who enjoy all other people?  do you know anyone like that?  are you one of those people?  if so, how do you do it?  how do people just not piss you off?  is there some sort of trick i should know about?  and do not send me a comment saying something snippy like "get over yourself, miss thang"  i am fully aware that i am no less obnoxious than most people.

i am a criminal. 
at approximately half past one today, i entered the el corral bookstore.  i proceeded to the art section to peruse the art supplies.  as i was looking at some packages of metal sheets, i phoned a friend to ask advice on brass vs. aluminum.  i lost reception.  i then wandered into the pen and pencil section and began browsing the merchandise.  the friend called me back, and we continued talking.  i became distracted and absently slipped the orange sharpie i had been holding into my pocket.  still on the phone, i left the bookstore and began walking home.  i reached the edge of campus, about where the stadium is, and i remember being vaguely aware of a golf cart in the road behind me.  suddenly, the golf cart screeches to a halt (i like to imagine that it is with tires squealing, rubber burning, and plenty of smoke) and two guys jump out.  "miss!"  one of them shouts.  "miss! may i speak with you for a second!?!"  
i am still unaware as to what the fuck is going on.
the guy in charge is steve from the bookstore.  i know him from having volunteered there briefly in the backpack tent.  he clearly does not remember this.
"do you have something you want to tell me?" he asks.
"uhhh.... no."
"did you not just take a pen from inside the store back there?" 
(waaaaay back there, like blocks away)
the realization hits.  AAAHHH!!!
i start apologizing frantically, explaining that i was on the phone at the time and didn't realize what i was doing, etc.  meanwhile, i am digging around in my jacket pocket for this stupid orange sharpie.  it takes me forever, but i finally dig it out, hand it to steve with another apology.  
i figure that is the end of it.
i figure wrong.
steve wants to take me to his office to talk things over.  he asks me if i am going to a final.
i say yes.  i am lying.  it occurs to me that i have no idea what time it is, and that given my luck it is probably like 2:23 or some other odd time to have a final.  so i blurt out that my final is at 3, then too late i discover that it only 2:07.  i start stammering about how my final is at 3 but that i really really have to study right that minute.
steve points out that 3 is an odd time to have a final.
he lets me go, but i have to make an appointment to go to his office and "talk about what happened".  he starts telling me how to find his office.  "i know where it is", i interject "i volunteered for you" 
steve is unfazed.  he confiscates my id card and i agree to show up after my imaginary final. 
i go home and freak out for a while.

when i return to campus, i am much more collected.  i get to his office and peek inside.  he is nowhere to be seen.  i wander down the hall to have one of the office ladies tell him i'm there.  eerily, he appears right behind me.  this guy is like a phantom.  he is everywhere.  
he sends me into his office then goes off to do something secretive and intimidating.  there is a small closet where the surveillance cameras are set up, and while i can't see inside, i can see a student employee sitting inside watching the monitors.  some lady walks in and sits at one of the desks.  i think to myself "sucks for you, lady.  steve is gonna be in here any minute now to kick you out so we can have this stupid meeting".  steve comes back.  there are still 2 other people in the room.  he shuts the door and starts telling me about his firm policy on privacy.  i am trying to be polite and cooperative, but i can't help but widen my eyes and make an incredulous gesture toward the 2 extra visitors.  
"those are my immediate staff" he tells me. "they can stay".  what the fuck is that supposed to mean?
anyways, he tells me that they have me on camera putting a pen into my pocket and then leaving, and that it would hold up in court.  i again tell him that the theft was unintentional.  i can tell he doesnt believe me, and because cameras can't capture human intentions, there is nothing to disprove the evidence or corroborate my story.  
now, i know there is no way that anyone is sending me to court, arresting me, or pressing charges over one orange sharpie.  but steve goes through some 30 minutes of intimidatory tactics anyways, walking me through all the courses of action that can be taken.  blah blah blah.  Course of Action C is the applicable Course in my circumstance.  Course of Action C is "civil reparations" which is basically blackmail.  it states that if i pay the bookstore for "damages" incurred by my taking a pen out of the store, plus a state fine, then they will not involve the cops, permanent records, etc.  sounds like blackmail to me.  
the minimum state fine as per ca statute 490.5 is in this case no less than $50, no more than $500.

i'd like to take time at this point to remind you that i took 
A SHARPIE.
ON ACCIDENT.
what. the. fuck. 

i could drag this out even more, but i'm just gonna stop typing.

You know the whole Apu stereotype of the Indian guy working behind the counter at 7-11?  Well, Geny and I pull up to our friendly neighborhood 7-11 last night to get some hot chocolate.  Who is behind the counter?  An Indian guy.  The bad part of me immediately goes "thank you, come again!", and the good part of me laughs for a second and then goes "come on, man.  that is messed up" and then lectures the bad part on stereotyping.
We go to get our hot chocolate.  Geny pushes the button marked "Ghiradelli hot cocoa", but the hot chocolate that comes out looks funny.  Geny tastes it, and it is real watery.  So she turns to the Indian guy and says something along the lines of "hey, your hot chocolate needs more chocolate!"  
The guy comes over to survey the situation, and informs us in broken English that: 
A) We are pushing the button wrong; don't push it so hard, and
B) the button corresponds not to hot chocolate, but to coffee.
Neither of these are true, and we wholeheartedly deny both allegations.  
My take on the situation is that the guy thinks "Ghiradelli" is the English word for coffe, or perhaps a type of coffee, ignoring the words "hot cocoa".
Anyways, we got Slurpees.
nobody likes me except for one creepy peruvian guy would people please please stop standing me up/blowing me off/getting mad at me/ignoring me?

i was walking down one of the hallways at school today, when i passed by a case full of awards and ribbons and such trappings.  i didn't get a good look at everything, but this image was burned into my retinas of a small-ish wooden plaque that read "3rd place cheddar cheese".
my school won 3rd place in cheddar cheese!  i have never really had any sort of penchant for school pride, but i am actually pretty pleased.  WAY TO GO, CAL POLY!  WAY TO GO, CHEDDAR CHEESE!
i think it would be a good idea at job interviews to declare solemnly that my alma mater holds the prestigious "3rd place cheddar cheese" title.

i am thinking about asking the 'rents for a station wagon for christmas. an old shitty one.
a) i can't think of anything else.  and i don't want to try.  i don't really need anything.
b) it sounds really fun to say "i got a station wagon for christmas".  "what did you get for christmas?" "a station wagon."
c) apparently i dig shitty ol' station wagons. i am not sure why. the realization is still settling in.

anyways, step one: get bachelor's degree
step two: get station wagon
step three: learn to drive station wagon.

(steps four through death:  mindless job as a cog in the corporate machine. *.  look forward to biz. cas. fri., happy hour, drinking to forget.  meet husband; marriage ensues.  health insurance.  2.5 kids, soccer practice, orthodontal bills, replace carpeting, etc.  send kids to college. take up knitting.  die.)

*also 401K but I have no idea what it is or where to place it chronologically.

1) I like rocks. I like thinking about rocks, and about how they are formed. I like looking at rocks. I like books about rocks. Rocks are just neat. Vote yes on rocks! 2) My ride home, otherwise known as Boyfriend, wants to leave tuesday morning. "OK" I said, as I generally have no qualms about skipping school. But, that was before I found out I have TWO tests on tuesday, for the same teacher. Doctor Fagan, conveniently and immaturely abbreviated to Dr. Fag., was being all bureaucratic about it when I asked if it would maybe be ok if he rescheduled the test, or if I retook it at a later date, or if i took it early. All spouting shit about how his tests are scheduled exactly 6 business days apart, about how Department Rules are pretty clear on The Issue, about how technically it would involve special permission from the Department Chair and this, and all manner of retarculousness. Allow me to sum up: a. i was frustrated b. i might be taking 2 tests tomorrow c. is it at all ironic that i haven't started preparing for these tests? 3) In other school-related news, the crisp scent of senior projects is in the air. I keep hearing people casually mention that they are developing a flight simulator, or (something I couldn't understand involving photons) or building fucking particle accelerators and whatnot. My friend that is, in all niceness, basically a retard, is doing something involving this machine that calculates the light-sensitivity and responsiveness of algae.(???) Me? I think I am writing a children's book. A multilingual children's book. I plan to start going around casually mentioning my "book deal" that is in the works, getting all haughty about "my book I'm working on", dropping hints about meetings with editors and publishers and publicists and the like. I think to up "my credibility as a serious author", I should start trying to keep my intense dislike of children "on the d-l". Children's book vs particle accelerator. Think about it. 4) I was home last night waiting for Kevin to call, as planned. And he did, as planned. Then he mentioned we had been invited to a cocktail party. NOT PLANNED! The next hour and a half was an awkward flurry of activity. I think most girls take 1-2 hours to get ready for that sort of thing, but I think most girls own dresses and don't have to get all frantic about it. I frantically called roommate #1, asked to borrow a dress, and then frantically tried on* like 7 dresses that didnt work: didn't fit, didn't match my shoes, etc. So then I called roommate #2, in whom I hadn't much faith because she is kind of a tomboy. But, turns out she has the. most awesome. dress. ever. Daaaaaamn it was sexy. So I called Kevin back to tell him that yes, i finally found a dress I could work, frantically showered, did my hair into some mom-style 'do, tried to put on some makeup, improvised a shoe repair, borrowed some sparkly earrings,etc. So there you go. I got all girlied up, and we went to a cocktail party. It was very much like a 6-th grade dance. There were a bunch of sorority-type girls in little black dresses dancing to Hanson (I swear to god they were dancing to Hanson). I showed up pimp-style with about a half-dozen young, uncomfortable-looking boys in slacks and skate shoes and gasp! button-up shirts! Tucked in! And nobody was "mixing". As in there was a definite 6-th grade-esque boy/girl dichotomy. I was disappointed. Usually when I hang out with said group of boys it is a total sausage-fest. So I expected at least one of them to at least try to get laid. It is my theory that girls in cocktail dresses are an especially easy lay. Think about it. They are going to be feeling a lot sexier than if they were wearing jeans. * Trying on dresses is so horrible! Have you ever tried it? So many straps and slippery layers of cloth and zippers and it is hard to even tell what is the top. I swear there were a couple that I just had to hold up like "wha???" and sit there and just THINK and THINK and APPLY LOGIC before I could even begin to try to put it on. Man, I tried stuff on that may not have even been an actual dress. I do not know. Ok, this has gone on quite long enough! (Something a dad would say, even though I have never heard a dad say it.)

So, I hopped online yesterday and ordered some generic brand printer ink, at a tiny fraction of what Epson would have liked me to pay them.
Don't you think buying things online is kind of nerve-wracking?  I do.  I am used to getting fucked over/swindled, and unfamiliar websites make me nervous.
But when I got home today, around 3 o clock, MY INK WAS HERE!
I am amazed at the quality of customer service!  The responsiveness was astounding, and i only paid like $3 or $4 for shipping.
I am not shilling for inkgrabber dot com or anything...
It's just that inkgrabber dot com has renewed my faith in humanity.
